Putin signals readiness for a long war and promises 'new success'
subhead: During an annual TV address on Friday, December 19, the Russian leader showed no signs of changing course on Russia's war on Ukraine, claiming that 'the ball is entirely in the court of Ukraine and its European sponsors.'

French PM ups pressure on government to avoid budget deadlock
subhead: After a joint committee failed to reach an agreement on France's contentious budget bill, the government plans to present a special law on Monday to ensure the continuity of the state.

title: BHV department store boss Frédéric Merlin fails to buy iconic Parisian store's building from Galeries Lafayette
subhead: According to Galeries Lafayette, the acquisition will be carried out by 'an anglophone player with recognized expertise in real estate asset management.'

title: As France tries to contain cattle lumpy skin disease, PM seeks Christmas truce with agricultural unions
subhead: The prime minister met Friday with leaders of France's main farming unions but did not announce any real change in managing an outbreak of lumpy skin disease, or contagious nodular dermatitis.

title: More than 1.7 million French schoolchildren face high 'pesticide pressure' levels
subhead: Le Monde and a team of 10 scientists have established a barometer to measure the potential pesticide exposure level around every French school.

A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhead: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.

title: In Paris, the number of homeless living in outdoor camps continues to rise
subhead: Outreach teams counted 663 tents in the main encampment areas of the French capital at the end of November, representing between 985 and 1,723 people. The rise is driven by a reduction in available shelter spaces and tighter restrictions on residency permits.

title: Trump dogged by cost of living crisis and Republican revolt
subhead: The US president tried to defuse Americans' dissatisfaction with the economy in a televised address on Wednesday. He continued to blame Joe Biden, but struggled to grasp the extent of the issue – provoking tensions within his own party.
